p: These lead to the activation of platelets and leukocytes (neutrophils, monocytes, lymphocytes, etc.), stimulation of adhesion molecules, adhesion of leukocytes to the endothelium, and proliferation of vascular muscle cells. These changes lead to the development and progression of arteriosclerosis, unstable or ruptured plaques, the generation of a thrombin-induced coagulation thrombus, and ultimately to various types of thrombosis ( Figure 5).
